sn41.9:1.7.pli: ‚ÄúImehi pana te, bhante, ti·πÅsamattehi vassehi atthi koci uttari manussadhammƒÅ alamariya√±ƒÅ·πáadassanaviseso adhigato phƒÅsuvihƒÅro‚Äùti?
sn41.9:1.7.en: ‚ÄúBut sir, in these thirty years have you achieved any superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones, a meditation at ease?‚Äù

sn41.9:1.11.en: how well explained the teaching is. For in thirty years you have achieved no superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones, no meditation at ease, only nakedness, baldness, and pokes in the buttocks.‚Äù

sn41.9:2.13.pli: Dhammassa svƒÅkkhƒÅtatƒÅ, yatra hi nƒÅma gihƒ´ odƒÅtavasano evar≈´pa·πÅ uttari manussadhammƒÅ alamariya√±ƒÅ·πáadassanavisesa·πÅ adhigamissati phƒÅsuvihƒÅra·πÅ.
sn41.9:2.13.en: how well explained the teaching is. For a white-clothed layperson can achieve such a superhuman distinction in knowledge and vision worthy of the noble ones, a meditation at ease.

mn53:19.1.en: When a noble disciple is accomplished in ethics, guards the sense doors, eats in moderation, and is dedicated to wakefulness; and they have seven good qualities, and they get the four absorptions‚Äîblissful meditations in the present life that belong to the higher mind‚Äîwhen they want, without trouble or difficulty, they are called a noble disciple who is a practicing trainee. Their eggs are unspoiled, and they are capable of breaking out of their shell, becoming awakened, and achieving the supreme sanctuary from the yoke.

mn137:3.1.en: ‚Äú‚ÄòThe six interior sense fields should be understood. The six exterior sense fields should be understood. The six classes of consciousness should be understood. The six classes of contact should be understood. The eighteen mental preoccupations should be understood. The thirty-six positions of sentient beings should be understood. Therein, relying on this, give up that. The Noble One cultivates the establishment of mindfulness in three cases, by virtue of which they are a Teacher worthy to instruct a group. Of all meditation teachers, it is he that is called the supreme guide for those who wish to train.‚Äô
